item.title: Playing around with Sibilant
item.description: I was recently playing around with Sibilant, a language that is stylistically similar to Lisp and compiles to JavaScript, and figured that I would give a brief overview of some of the interesting concepts. There are a whole bunch of languages that compile to JS, and even some others that are also stylistically similar to Lisp like ClojureScript. Getting started Let’s see some example Sibilant code and see how it compiles to get a better understanding of how it works.
